name: Shilo Inn Hotel and Suites - Yuma

reviews.text: We were happy with this hotel. I thought the pool was very nice. They have a pretty good breakfast in the morning. Our rooms were spacious and clean. I did notice the hallyways had a funny smell, but maybe because they allow pets, I don't know. Half the equipment was out of order in fitness room...but I managed with what did work. Also like the fact they have guest laundry available. Just booked for another stay in September when we come back to go to Los Algodones for the dentist.
reviews.title: Will be staying there again shortly

reviews.text: We stayed here on our way to San Diego. The biggest reason I chose this hotel was for the huge swimming pool and jacuzzi. I was willing to spend a little more for that. The pool was disgusting. It was so hot. There was pipping hot water coming into the pool (little holes in the walls). Therefore I knew that this was a heated pool. The jacuzzi was colder than the pool. Of course in 116 weather- I don't want to be in the jacuzzi. I do also have a pool of my own in Mesa. Believe it or not it is very refreshing even in the heat. Of course we go out in the evening. This is why I was so mad. The pool should have never been that hot. In addition the pool lights weren't working. I went to the front dest to complain as I saw a little toddler off by himself in a dark pool. Nobody apologized or seemed to care about this. In my mind (and as a nurse), I think this is a huge liability. What's wrong w/ people? I came back the next morning- no apology. He (front desk manager) just said that the pool has been having problems. If your just coming here to sleep- the beds are very nice, the room is clean and quiet- Don't use the pool/ jacuzzi. If I had known this I would have stayed at the Motel 6.
reviews.title: NOT THAT GREAT

reviews.text: i had visited this hotel in 1995 when it was fairly new. this trip i had 5 people in the party(including a 15 and 17 yr. old)! we were treated wonderfully by the staff and given accomidations that met the needs of our group and at a very reasonable rate. the area has really grown since my 1st visit, and the staff made sure we were comfortable in the surroundings. the breakfast was above standard, pool area was clean and secure, room was clean and well maintained. in need of extra towels, coffee, or anything...just ask. we spent 9 days in AZ and the days spent at this hotel were the best and most comfortable. we didn't even mind the teenagers!!! would definately recommend and will definately return ourselves.
reviews.title: definately recommend this hotel

reviews.text: I was aghast when I realized that my Bose Quietcomfort 15 headset was missing. At first I thought the worst--it was either stolen or lost.
reviews.title: Sheri Doney, the Shilo Inns Yuma, General Manager, saved the day!

reviews.text: After checking with the Shilo Inns Manager, Sheri Doney, she assured me her staff would find my prized headset. I had my doubts since I travel quite a bit and don't usually lose my equipment. She calmly asked me for my contact information and a couple of hours to trace her door logs and ask her team about the item.
reviews.title: Would Definitely Stay Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Watch out for this dirty rundown hotel. We booked through Hotwire. This is a dirty stinky rundown ant ridden hotel that was rated a 3 star. It is not even a 1 star. We had to keep our shoes on because the carpets a filfthy. We did a load of laundry and our laundry came out with blue ink on it. By 11pm we called hotwire and told them..they were very good and moved us at midnight to the Hilton Garden. If you use a service that promises a clean room and they give you the Shilo...call immediately and get moved. Do not sleep in the bed. There are ants in the beds and on the walls and in the bathroom.
reviews.title: DIRTY DIRTY WITH ANTS

reviews.text: This place should be considered a 2 star motel. Totally outdated, creepy, and run down. Stray cats in the parking lot. The room smelled musty and smoky. Dark hallways with carpet that looks like it was a thousand years old. The thermostat was broken. Noisy neighbors having sex and blasting the tv all night long. Outside traffic was loud, so I barely got any sleep. Sketchy looking people everywhere. Police patrolling the lobby. The guy who checked me into the hotel looked like he was on drugs. I hope I didn't catch anything while I was here because this place is an absolute dump. You couldn't pay me to stay here again!!!
reviews.title: What a joke! Didn't this used to be the nicest hotel in Yuma?

reviews.text: Excellent location, while building is older, renovations have everything current. Nice pool and spa area, adequate free breakfast comparable to most others. Huge room for the money. Includes small fridge and microwave. Found everything very clean and comfortable, including beds, and friendly staff. Read other reviews about noise, could hear shower running above, or kids running in hallway, but not loud enough to disturb me. Will be back next time!
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: This hotel could use some serious updating. Room was fairly noisy and the bed was at best poor and lumpy. Good thing my husband unwrapped the drinking glasses provided in the room. One was cracked and there was loose glass pieces on the bottom of the glass, all of this covered by the shrink/plastic wrap. The front desk attendant was apologetic and said she would have the General Manager call us. That was several days ago and still no phone call. Guess this tells us how much they value their guests. Would not recommend this Shilo Inn to anyone.
reviews.title: Be careful!!!!!

reviews.text: This was a good buy but don't expect luxury. Staff was very friendly; location is great; close to shopping and dining. Bed was comfortable and linens were good. Slight odor in hallways.
reviews.title: Good buy

reviews.text: This hotel was disappointing. When I called the hotel from a stop at the Sam’s club, I asked for a non-smoking, “no pet” room. I was informed they had rooms available and given a price. When we checked in I once again asked for a non-smoking and “no pet” room. We were escorted to the room for an inspection and did notice an odor. It was not overbearing so we thought it would be OK. The gentleman who showed us the room said he could spray, but we didn’t want that. So, we checked, and turned on the air vent. The odor never did seem to vacate the room. The room was otherwise comfortable.
reviews.title: Careful of room odors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning my wife went to use the shower and the shower head was so corroded it water sprayed out from all different directions. I tried to fix it temporarily but couldn’t get it so it didn’t shoot out of the shower. So, my wife used the water coming out of the bottom of the faucet. When I got in the shower I did manage to get the water to keep from spraying out of the shower (mostly).
reviews.title: GOOD LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I left the room to go for some breakfast, I noticed a woman next to our room coming back from outside with a dog. I am thinking, is only our room pet free?
reviews.title: Great pool, .......

reviews.text: When I went for breakfast I informed the front desk about the shower head and told them not to fix it right now as we were done with our showers. I didn’t mention pets at that time. When we checked out, I mentioned the fact that there was a pet next to our room and I thought that area was pet free. The man behind the desk said they are pet friendly and DON’T HAVE ANY PET FREE ROOMS. I told him what we were told the night before and he asked who was on duty. I described the person. They did take $20 off the bill for the shower head which was a nice gesture but the pet issue concerned us more. We have problems with pet dander. Now I recognized the odor in our room - cat urine!
reviews.title: We will definitely stay here again

reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed with this hotel and would not stay again.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay for us and our furry babies

reviews.text: stayed there from june/3-7th, checked in ealry am, desk clerk very helpful and professional. street view room. clean, roomy, great gym, steam room, big cool pool, hot tub was very nice!! walkin distance to yuma palms. everything u could want at a great price!! would stay again when in yuma!
reviews.title: outstanding stay, great price!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, we stayed here for one night. Room was very clean and rate was great compared to the other chain hotels in the area. Super convenient to shopping mall and restaurant but not sure we felt comfortable staying here. Wasn't a bad stay and can't quite say why we didn't like it....... maybe it was because it seemed a bit creepy with the long dark corridors. Hotel badly needs refurbishing.
reviews.title: Still not sure about this hotel

reviews.text: enjoyed the stay, great location. the only criticisim i have, which i shared with the front desk staff, was that the air conditioning unit needed to be improved, it was either too cold or too warm in the room. we stayed on the third floor and there was no bad/horrible smell.
reviews.title: very satisfied, would definetly endorse it

reviews.text: One of the best hotels I have stayed in for the price or even three times the price. I can't believe that some of the negative reviews were about the same hotel I stayed in. The desk people were great, the rooms were stopless and beautifully decorated. I would never stay anywhere else in Yuma and will recommend this hotel to all my friens.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel for the money.

reviews.text: I just returned from a 15 day stay at this hotel. I found it very welcomeing. The service people were very helpful, pleasant and very accomodating to your wishes. The rooms were spacious and clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to spend time In Yuma. Close to a huge shopping centre as well as resturants.
reviews.title: awesome people to work with

description: The friendly staff at the Shilo Inn Hotel & Suites will welcome you with gracious Shilo hospitality. Each of the 134 spacious rooms and suites are tastefully decorated with southwestern furnishings. Children 12 and under always stay free with an adult at Shilo Inns. Dogs welcome.
